itemDescription: 5th century Welsh abbot of Saint-Brieuc in Brittany and Llandyfriog  in Wales

wikipedia_page.main: Saint Brioc (Breton: Brieg; Welsh: Briog; Cornish: Breock; French: Brieuc; died c. 502) was a 5th-century Welsh holy man who became the first abbot of Saint-Brieuc in Brittany. He is one of the seven founder saints of Brittany.
